keyMoments.title: Revokes Law's Shichibukai Status
keyMoments.description: Fujitora officially revokes Trafalgar Law's title as Shichibukai after Law confirms his alliance with the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Fujitora's role as an enforcer of justice and creates major consequences for Law's alliance.
keyMoments.quote: I hereby revoke your title as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea!

keyMoments.title: Summons Meteor from Space
keyMoments.description: Fujitora uses his Zushi Zushi no Mi powers to summon a massive meteor from outer space, demonstrating the devastating scale of his gravity manipulation abilities.
keyMoments.significance: First major display of Fujitora's true power in the anime, establishing him as one of the most dangerous admirals.
keyMoments.quote: I was just testing my strength a little.

abilities.description: Uses gravity manipulation to pull meteors from outer space and direct them toward targets on the ground.
Channels gravity through his sword to slice through meteors and other objects.

reveals.information: Can summon meteors from outer space using gravity manipulation

name.japanese: トラファルガー・ロー

keyMoments.title: Shichibukai Status Revoked
keyMoments.description: Admiral Fujitora officially revokes Law's title as Shichibukai after Law confirms his alliance with the Straw Hats is genuine.
keyMoments.significance: Major turning point for Law, losing the protection of the World Government and becoming a fully wanted pirate again.

keyMoments.title: Cuts Fujitora's Meteor
keyMoments.description: Law uses his Ope Ope no Mi abilities to help slice the meteor that Fujitora summoned, demonstrating his ability to respond to admiral-level threats.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Law can hold his own against admiral-level powers and sets up the three-way confrontation.

bounties.reason: Shichibukai status revoked, alliance with Straw Hats confirmed

reveals.information: No longer a Shichibukai, fully wanted pirate

keyMoments.title: Lies About Being Noland's Descendant
keyMoments.description: Usopp lies to the Tontatta dwarves that he is a descendant of Mont Blanc Noland. The dwarves call him 'Usoland' and ask for his help in defeating the Doflamingo Pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Usopp's lie traps him into a position of leadership and responsibility, forcing him to step up despite his fear. This becomes a pivotal moment in his character development.

relationships.description: Usopp falsely claims to be a descendant of Mont Blanc Noland to gain the trust of the Tontatta dwarves.

evolutionMoments.description: Usopp lies about being Noland's descendant and is proclaimed as 'Usoland' by the dwarves.

relationships.description: Leo and the Tontatta dwarves view Usopp as their prophesied hero who will lead them to victory against Doflamingo.

evolutionMoments.description: Leo and the dwarves proclaim Usopp as their hero and ask him to lead them in battle.

reveals.information: Known as 'Usoland' by the Tontatta dwarves

keyMoments.title: Tames the Fighting Bull with Haki
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses his Conqueror's Haki to tame the Fighting Bull nicknamed 'Brutal Bull' Ucy in the Corrida Colosseum. Ucy becomes friendly and allows Luffy to ride him.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's growing mastery of Haki and his unique ability to befriend even the most aggressive creatures.

relationships.description: Luffy tames Ucy and befriends the fighting bull, riding him in the Colosseum battles.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy tames Ucy with Haki and gains a powerful ally in the Colosseum.

keyMoments.title: Tamed by Luffy
keyMoments.description: Ucy, a violent fighting bull in the Corrida Colosseum, is tamed by Luffy's Conqueror's Haki and becomes his ally in the tournament.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of a powerful ally for Luffy in the Colosseum battles and demonstration of Luffy's ability to befriend creatures.

relationships.description: Tamed and befriended by Luffy, Ucy becomes a loyal companion in the Colosseum.

evolutionMoments.description: Ucy is tamed by Luffy and allows him to ride him in battle.

reveals.information: A fighting bull who regularly competed as a gladiator in Dressrosa's Corrida Colosseum, having defeated many death row inmates

keyMoments.title: Explains Noland's History with the Dwarves
keyMoments.description: Leo explains to Robin and Usopp that Mont Blanc Noland came to their island 400 years ago and saved the dwarves from bad humans who were ravaging their island.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial backstory connecting to the Skypiea arc and validates Noland's reputation as a hero.
keyMoments.quote: Noland came to our island 400 years ago and fought with the bad humans that were ravaging our island and led the dwarves to victory.

keyMoments.title: Reunites with Kin'emon
keyMoments.description: Sanji reunites with Kin'emon after being separated in Dressrosa. They work together to fend off Doflamingo's men.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the ongoing coordination efforts of the alliance members scattered across Dressrosa.

keyMoments.title: Learns About Noland's Connection to the Dwarves
keyMoments.description: Robin realizes that a statue in the Tontatta Kingdom is of Mont Blanc Noland and learns about his heroic actions 400 years ago.
keyMoments.significance: Provides Robin with crucial historical information connecting multiple arcs and validates Noland's story.
